column4: why do people re-install when something doesn't work and expect it to work?
depends on what went wrong
i've reinstalled tons of times because i thought I had installed something bad and couldn't track down waht it was.....
that's why you should use synaptic
it keeps a log of all packages you install
you can just backtrack
ummm...yeah - i use synaptic
and it turned out to not be a package install problem
what was the problem?
and i used google and found no help for my problem
and nobody here could help either....
gnome freezing at startup
so, you reinstalled and now it works fine?
no
yes i reinstalled and no reinstalling didn't fix the problem, but yes, it works fine now
how did you fix it?
i figured out that it just needed to sit there.  after 5 or 10 minutes, it finally came up and hasn't "frozen" since.
did you check what was running in top?
yeah - nothing was eating up CPU.  gdm was running....
i'm chalking it up to something just blocking for a while needing to timeout or something....  works great now..
that's good
you should be able to read all about the adventure on o'reilly's site soon
he had the same problem?
who?
